comments.author: KO
comments.content: We took along a brand new video camera just for the trip, but didn’t film much at the end.

comments.author: Dr. Shahid Iqbal
comments.content: Good work. From where v can get these in Lahore and list of food items required. Can I talk / meet u directly.thx.

comments.author: thomas Sheldon
comments.content: Thank you for a very informative article. I’m planning on a trip to the Karakoram form the USA for trekking and would like to contact you directly with some trip planning questions. please get back to me at email removed. Thanks.

comments.author: Adeel Sattar
comments.content: Hi, i had a few questions regarding the trip… am living in lahore and working in telenor. I am panning my annual leaves to K2 base camp in August 08… Need a few partners to tag along… My contact is 0092 3454001192.

comments.author: Camping Lover
comments.content: Love the backbacking list! Sunblock is a must! But where’d the cream cheese come from? lol I do suggest that anyone who takes a trip make a backpacking list. You won’t regret it!

comments.author: Khalid Omar
comments.content: Dunno, the cheese just found it’s way onto a shopping cart and landed up on the list… It was quite good though, cream cheese and biscuit sandwich.

comments.author: Adeel
comments.content:
Guys I’m very impressed with the details u’ve covered. Its a good piece of information for other people. Pictures with comments are also amazing.

I did hiking in these areas many years back and then I started going to Northern areas by motor bike while camping on the way. At that time I hardly find and any Pakistani explorers in the higher north though I always wondered why v ourselves dont explore our country while others do with passion. Its been a while since I last visited mountains in Pak. I would love to go back there in my next trip to Pakistan.

comments.author: Naveed warraich
comments.content: Very nice explanation of northern areas of pk and K2 base camp. I m also very interested like other friends but the main problem is that there is a little interest in hiking and tracking. I always try to my best to find a friend who walk with me but it seems that 99.9% of our peoples likes luxurious life but i like those who want to cross the world on foot not those who can’t walk a step without vehicle. Thanx again for very nice & important tips, tricks and sharing the views.

comments.author: Shoaib Burq
comments.content: Thanks KO this should come in very handy!

comments.author: saqib
comments.content: Great job guys I’m extremely impressed by the effort you guys have put in here. I am planning a trip to K2s base camp myself in June and hopefully summitting one peaks above 8000 m. I stumbled accross your website while doing some research. You’ve made my life a lot simpler. Great job guys and thanks a lot.

comments.author: hamza
comments.content: hey u bought climbing rope…where did u buy it from…i need a good quality dynamic climbing rope for rock climbing…any ideas?

comments.author: Qaisera
comments.content: I am very glad to see post. This post have very relevant information in this blog.

comments.author: sonoo
comments.content: I love to go for hiking, nice information guys.

comments.author: pakistan
comments.content: Very informative and well briefed topic. I would love to go there, although it will be too cold there.

comments.author: Make Money
comments.content: Nice information. This year I am planning to go to base camp of K2.

comments.author: Ali Asghar
comments.content: nice info bro. You have explained everythink quite comprihensively. For past few months i have been completely obsessed with K2 and have been doing some research. is it true that early august is the best month to go there?

comments.author: Deep
comments.content: Im planning to go there this summer…can I join someone who is already going?
